intro: Blepharocalyx spirioides, commonly known as the spiral-leaf balsa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is known for its lightweight, porous wood, which has been historically used in model building and other crafts. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native habitat.
